text:
An F-distribution is presented in Figure 9. As indicated, the F-distribution is rightskewed and is truncated at zero on the left-hand side. The shape of the F-distribution
is determined by two separate degrees of freedom, the numerator degrees of freedom, df,,
and the denominator degrees of freedom, df,. Also shown in Figure 9 is that the rejection
region is in the right-side tail of the distribution. This will always be the case as long
as the F-statistic is computed with the largest sample variance in the numerator. The
labeling of 1 and 2 is arbitrary anyway.
